Fitting Workflow

Source: vignettes/fitting_workflow.Rmd
fitting_workflow.Rmd

This vignette outlines a complete fit-to-data workflow for chlaa using a synthetic daily incidence time-series. The synthetic data are generated from the model and then observed with over-dispersed count noise, yielding a single-wave outbreak profile (rapid rise, short peak, gradual decline) that is broadly similar in shape to reported cholera outbreak curves.

library(chlaa)
set.seed(42)
# 1) Build baseline parameters
pars <- cholera_parameters()
# 2) Generate synthetic observed case data (daily counts)
# We first simulate a baseline outbreak, then add observation noise.
time <- 1:70
pars$contact_rate <- 4
pars$trans_prob <- 0.015
pars$reporting_rate <- 0.01
pars$obs_size <- 20

sim_truth <- cholera_simulate(pars, time = time, n_particles = 1, dt = 1, seed = 42)
mu_obs <- pmax(pars$reporting_rate * sim_truth$inc_symptoms, 0.01)
cases <- rnbinom(length(mu_obs), mu = mu_obs, size = pars$obs_size)
data_raw <- data.frame(day = time, cases = as.integer(cases))

plot(data_raw$day, data_raw$cases, type = "h", lwd = 2,
     xlab = "Day", ylab = "Reported cases",
     main = "Synthetic cholera-like outbreak data")

# 3) Prepare and validate case data
data_fit <- cholera_prepare_data(data_raw, time_col = "day", cases_col = "cases")
head(data_fit)
#>   time cases
#> 1    1     0
#> 2    2     0
#> 3    3     0
#> 4    4     0
#> 5    5     0
#> 6    6     0
# 4) Fit with pMCMC
# Keep settings lightweight so the vignette runs quickly in CI.
fit <- cholera_fit_pmcmc(
  data = data_fit,
  pars = pars,
  n_particles = 50,
  n_steps = 250,
  seed = 42,
  proposal_var = 1e-5
)
#> ⡀⠀ Sampling  ■                                |   0% ETA:  9s
#> ✔ Sampled 250 steps across 1 chain in 1s
#> 
fit
#> <cholera_fit>
#> Posterior draws: 250 iterations; 9 parameters
#> Data: 70 observations; time range [1, 70]
# 5) Posterior summaries and diagnostics
summary_tbl <- cholera_posterior_summary(fit, burnin = 0.3, thin = 2)
summary_tbl
#> # A tibble: 9 × 6
#>   parameter             mean      sd `q2p5%`  `q50%` `q97p5%`
#>   <chr>                <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 trans_prob          0.0130 0.00113  0.0103  0.0132   0.0143
#> 2 contact_rate        3.97   0.00663  3.97    3.98     3.99  
#> 3 incubation_time     4.86   0.00425  4.85    4.85     4.86  
#> 4 duration_sym       14.5    0.00439 14.5    14.5     14.5   
#> 5 reporting_rate      0.0113 0.00160  0.0100  0.0106   0.0156
#> 6 obs_size           20.0    0.00954 20.0    20.0     20.0   
#> 7 seek_severe         0.701  0.0156   0.677   0.702    0.727 
#> 8 fatality_untreated  0.480  0.00460  0.474   0.480    0.491 
#> 9 fatality_treated    0.0240 0.00646  0.0123  0.0220   0.0385
diag_report <- cholera_fit_report(fit, burnin = 0.3, thin = 2)
diag_report$acceptance_rate
#> [1] 0.2873563
trace_plot <- cholera_plot_trace(fit, parameters = c("trans_prob", "contact_rate"))
trace_plot

# 6) Posterior predictive checks
ppc_plot <- cholera_plot_ppc(
  fit,
  data = data_fit,
  n_draws = 40,
  burnin = 0.3,
  thin = 2,
  seed = 42
)
ppc_plot
